description: This trap message is generated when Ces port status changed.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwCesPortStatusTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortStatus i 4
$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwCesPortStatusTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortStatus i 1
$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwCesPortStatusTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortStatus i 2

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Indicate the port state.
Options:
1. normal(1) - The port is in normal state
2. test(2) - The port is in test state
3. idle(3) - The port is in idle state
4. notExisted(4) - The port doesn't exist
5. fail(5) - The port is in fail state
6. block(6) - The port is in block state
7. maintain(7) - The port is in maintain state
8. loopback(11) - The port is in loopback state
variables.name: HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortStatus

description: This trap message is generated when E1T1 board work mode changed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwCesBoardWorkModeChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesCfgAccessMode i 1

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Board work mode.
Options:
variables.name: HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesCfgAccessMode

description: This trap message is generated when Ces port work mode changed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwCesPortWorkModeChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortCfgWorkMode i -1 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortCfgClockMode i -1 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortCfgSignalType i -1 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortCfgFrameVerifyMode i -1 HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortAcmSource i 9999

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: The working mode of port.
Options:
1. uni(1) - UNI mode
2. sdt(2) - SDT mode
3. udt(3) - UDT mode
4. idle(4) - Idle mode
5. ima(5) - IMA mode
6. invalidMode(-1) - Invalid mode
variables.name: HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortCfgWorkMode

description: The clock mode of port.
Options:
1. system(1) - System clock
2. line(2) - Line clock
3. acm(3) - Acm clock
4. srts(4) - Srts clock
5. invalidClock(-1) - Invalid clock
variables.name: HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortCfgClockMode

description: Signal type of port.
Options:
1. ccs(1) - CCS signal
2. cas(2) - CAS signal
3. invalidSignal(-1) - Invalid signal
variables.name: HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortCfgSignalType

description: Frame verify mode of port.
Options:
1. enable(1) - Open frame verify
2. disable(2) - Close frame verify
3. invalidOrNotSupport(-1) - Invalid or does not support frame verify
variables.name: HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortCfgFrameVerifyMode

description: Configuration of adaptive clock source.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CES-MIB::hwAtmCesPortAcmSource
